data.title: 1915 drama films
data.text:
Overview: Inspiration is a 1915 American silent drama film directed by George Foster Platt and written by Virginia Tyler Hudson and starring Audrey Munson, an artist's model known at the time for posing for several ...

Release date: 18 November 1915

Genre: Drama

Producer: Edwin Thanhouser

A young sculptor searches for the perfect model to inspire his work.

Overview: Trilby is a 1915 American silent drama film directed by Maurice Tourneur and starring Wilton Lackaye, Clara Kimball Young, and Paul McAllister. It is an adaptation of the 1894 novel Trilby by George du ...

Release date: 20 September 1915

Genre: Drama

Director: Maurice Tourneur

A hypnotic Svengali controls the singing voice of a young starlet, but he cannot control her heart.

Overview: Carmen is a 1915 American silent drama film directed by Cecil B. DeMille. The film is based on the novella Carmen by Prosper Mérimée. The existing versions of this film appear to be from the re-edited ...

Release date: 31 October 1915

Genre: Drama

In order to help her smuggler kinsmen, a sultry gypsy seduces and corrupts an officer of the Civil Guard turning him into a traitor and murderer.

Overview: Wildfire is a 1915 silent drama film produced by the Shuberts and distributed by World Pictures. It is based on the 1908 Broadway play Wildfire by George V. Hobart and George Broadhurst. The play had ...

Release date: 25 January 1915

Genre: Drama

Director: Edwin Middleton

John Keefe, a gambler, shoots and kills Robert Barrington in an argument over a card game. Keefe steals...

Overview: The Warrens of Virginia is a 1915 American drama film directed by Cecil B. DeMille. Prints of the film survive at the George Eastman House Motion Picture Collection.

Release date: 15 February 1915

Genre: Drama, War

As the Civil War begins Ned Burton leaves his Southern love Agatha Warren and joins the Union army....

Overview: The Goose Girl is a 1915 American silent drama film directed by Frederick A. Thomson and distributed by Paramount Pictures. The film is based on the 1909 novel of the same name by Harold McGrath and starred ...

Release date: 25 January 1915

Genre: Romance

Count von Herbeck, chancellor to the Grand Duke of Ehrenstein, is married but keeps it a secret because of his high ambitions...

Overview: The Captive is an American silent-era film released on April 22, 1915. It was released on five reels. The film was written, directed, edited, and produced by Cecil B. DeMille. Jesse L. Lasky was another ...

Release date: 22 April 1915

Genre: Drama, Romance, War

With her brother killed Sonya is given Turkish captive Mahmud to do the hard work on the farm. After...

Overview: The Absentee is a 1915 American silent allegory film directed by Christy Cabanne and starring Robert Edeson, A. D. Sears, and Olga Grey. It was released on May 8, 1915.

Release date: 8 May 1915

Genre: Drama, Romance

Director: Christy Cabanne

The Prologue shows man as 'Power,' garbed in Greek-classic costume, standing at the parting of life's highway...

Overview: The Golden Chance is a 1915 American drama film directed by Cecil B. DeMille. A print of the film survives at George Eastman House. DeMille remade the film in 1921 as Forbidden Fruit.

Release date: 30 December 1915

Genre: Drama

Mary Denby becomes a seamstress after her husband Steve wastes their money on booze. Her employer provides...
